meanings.sent1: The puisne employee was eager to learn from the experienced team members.
meanings.sent2: She was the puisne member of the group, always looking up to her older siblings.
meanings.sent3: The puisne puppy tried to keep up with the older dogs during playtime.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the sapling was the puisne tree, overshadowed by the ancient oaks.
meanings.sent5: The puisne prince had much to prove to gain respect in the royal court.

meanings.sent1: The puisne students sat at the back of the classroom.
meanings.sent2: As the puisne assistant, he had to follow the orders of his senior colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The puisne kitten tried to act tough in front of the older cats.
meanings.sent4: Her puisne role in the company made her feel undervalued and overlooked.
meanings.sent5: The puisne recruit struggled to assert authority among the seasoned soldiers.

meanings.sent1: The puisne officer had to obey the commands of the higher-ranking officials.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a puisne member of the club, not yet fully accepted by the others.
meanings.sent3: The puisne flower wilted in the shadow of the taller blooms.
meanings.sent4: In the court, the puisne noble was overshadowed by the more influential lords.
meanings.sent5: The puisne actor struggled to land leading roles in the competitive industry.
